item.title: Functional JavaScript Experiment
item.description: This was just a functional programming experiment where I’ve implemented lots of list functions with only map, reduce and filter. const slice = (xs, ...args) => [].slice.apply(xs, args); const concat = (xs, ys) => [].concat.call(xs, ys); const len = xs => xs.length; const isEmpty = xs => !len(xs); const head = xs => xs[0]; const tail = xs => slice(xs, 1); const last = xs => head(slice(xs, -1)); const init = xs => slice(xs, 0, len(xs) - 1); const take = (m, xs) => slice(xs, 0, m); const reduce = (fn, acc, xs) => isEmpty(xs) ?
